introText: The Ministry for Seniors and Accessibility works to improve accessibility and support seniors' needs, promoting inclusive communities and age-friendly policies across Ontario.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry for Seniors and Accessibility spent $171M in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 0.1% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This investment supports seniors and accessibility initiatives.
roleText: Ontario's aging population and commitment to accessibility require dedicated support. This ministry develops policies and programs to support seniors' independence and ensure communities are accessible to all Ontarians.
programsDescription: The Ministry for Seniors and Accessibility operates programs including seniors' services, accessibility funding, home modification support, caregiver tax credits, and accessibility compliance oversight.
